result.execSummary:
The defendant Alonzo Jeremy Martin was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case. One or more other charges in this case were dismissed. The dismissed charges were not proven and have no legal effect. Alonzo Jeremy Martin is presumed innocent of the dismissed charges.

  • Alonzo Jeremy Martin was found guilty of Possess Firearm-Convicted of a Felony [Modifiers: Habitual Criminality Repeater], a class G felony, Wisconsin Statutes 941.29(1m)(a).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: With credit for 212 days time served.

superMiscConds.notes:
- Mental health evaluation, take all prescribed medications.
- Provide DNA Sample.
- AODA assessment, comply with recommended treatment.

supervisions.notes:
- Court waives all non-mandatory costs due to inability to pay.
- Restitution set at $0.00.
- All mandatory court costs, fees, and assessments to be paid out of defendant's prison funds at an amount to be determined by the DOC and as a condition of extended supervision. Failure to pay will result in a civil judgment.
- Any cash bail on deposit to apply if applicable.

- No contact with firearms.
*Court advised due to felony conviction the defendant is prohibited from firearm possession, and defendant's voting rights are suspended and may not vote until civil rights are restored.

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Alonzo Jeremy Martin

records.addlTxt:
Defendant Alonzo Jeremy Martin in court.  Attorney Michael B Plaisted in court for Alonzo Jeremy Martin.  Prosecuting attorney Katie Bakunowicz in court for the State of Wisconsin.
 
Case in court for Sentencing Hearing. 

Parties prepared to proceed with sentencing. State advised the Court they have complied with the Victims' Rights Law. Statements by each counsel and defendant as to sentencing.

As to Count 1:The court sentenced the defendant to a MAXIMUM term in the Wisconsin State Prison of 4 years, with credit for 212 DAYS time served, the term of INITIAL CONFINEMENT is 2 years, the term of EXTENDED SUPERVISION is 2 years. 

CONDITIONS OF EXTENDED SUPERVISION:
- AODA assessment, comply with recommended treatment.
- Mental health evaluation, take all prescribed medications.
- Provide DNA Sample.
- No contact with firearms.
- Court waives all non-mandatory costs due to inability to pay.
- Restitution set at $0.00.
- All mandatory court costs, fees, and assessments to be paid out of defendant's prison funds at an amount to be determined by the DOC and as a condition of extended supervision. Failure to pay will result in a civil judgment.
- Any cash bail on deposit to apply if applicable.


*Court finds defendant is NOT eligible for the Challenge Incarceration Program OR the Wisconsin Substance Abuse Program.
*Court advised defendant of right to seek post conviction relief.
*Court advised due to felony conviction the defendant is prohibited from firearm possession, and defendant's voting rights are suspended and may not vote until civil rights are restored.
Court ordered defendant REMANDED into the custody of the Milwaukee County Sheriff's Department.

Defendant Alonzo Jeremy Martin in court with attorney Michael B Plaisted. Student Intern Jessica Birmingham under the supervision of  Katie Bakunowicz appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Parties have reached an agreement. State places offer on the record. Defense and defendant are in agreement.

Pursuant to negotiations and on the Motion of the State, Court Ordered Count 2 DISMISSED BUT READ IN for the purpose of sentencing.

Pursuant to negotiations and on the Motion of the State, Court Ordered Counts 3 AND 4 DISMISSED.

AS TO COUNT 1: Defendant changes plea(s) to GUILTY. Defendant examined as to plea, advised of Constitutional Rights and the maximum penalties. Defendant further advised that if not a US citizen, deportation is possible. Court found that the defendant knowingly, voluntarily and intelligently waived rights.  Plea Questionnaire/Waiver of Rights form, Addendum, and Elements/Jury Instructions received and filed. Parties stipulate to the Criminal Complaint as a factual basis to sustain defendant's plea(s).  Court found defendant GUILTY and ordered a Judgment of Conviction be entered on the record.  

Case adjourned to Branch 29 for Sentencing.  Sentencing hearing scheduled for August 24, 2022 at 03:30 pm.

Defendant Alonzo Jeremy Martin in court with attorney Michael B Plaisted.  Katie Bakunowicz appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Case set for a jury trial. State is prepared to proceed with a jury trial on counts 1 and 2. State is not prepared to proceed on counts 3 and 4. Defense moves to dismiss counts 3 and 4 and advises the Court defendant wishes to hire a private attorney. Court takes motion under advisement and passes case.
Pretrial Services Supervision Report 06-27-2022, filed.
Pretrial Services Violation Report 06-12-2022, filed and forwarded to the Judge for review.
